meanings.definition: A distinctive taste or smell, especially one that is pleasant.
meanings.sent1: The bakery was filled with the sweet sapors of freshly baked bread.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the sapors of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The sapors of the delicious meal made her mouth water.
meanings.sent4: The sapors of nostalgia filled the air as she entered her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The sapors of success lingered in the room long after the award ceremony ended.

meanings.definition: To perceive or recognize the taste or smell of something.
meanings.sent1: He could easily sapors the aroma of coffee brewing in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She tried to sapors the scent of the ocean carried by the breeze.
meanings.sent3: As she walked into the room, she could sapors the delicious dinner being prepared.
meanings.sent4: The detective could sapors the faint smell of smoke in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: Even with a stuffy nose, she could sapors the strong scent of the flowers.
